verses.text: In the Lordput I my trust: How say ye to my soul, Flee asa bird toyour mountain?
For lo, the wicked bend theirbow, They make ready their arrow upon the string, That theymay privily shoot at the upright in heart.
If the foundations be destroyed, What can the righteous do?
The Lordisin his holy temple, The Lordâ€™sthrone isin heaven: His eyes behold, His eyelids try, the children of men.
The Lordtrieth the righteous: But the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.
Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, And a horrible tempest: this shall bethe portion of their cup.
For the righteous Lordloveth righteousness; His countenance doth behold the upright.
